message.content:
cs.MS, cs.DC, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.AR. 

The paper presents a domain-specific language (DSL) for physical simulation that runs efficiently on both CPUs and GPUs. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.MS (Mathematical Software), cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), cs.PL (Programming Languages), cs.SE (Software Engineering), and cs.AR (Hardware Architecture). However, given the focus on simulation and parallel computing, cs.MS and cs.DC are the most likely categories. The paper also discusses the use of a three-layer architecture and a common, unified, relational data model, which could be relevant to cs.PL and cs.SE. Finally, the evaluation section compares Ebb to several widely used simulations, which could be relevant to cs.AR.
